p: According to the results of the nationwide model, a single threshold effect F 1 was statistically significant at about the 5% level ( p-value = 0.06), while the tests for a double F 2 and a triple threshold F 3 were not significant. This indicated that a single temperature threshold exists at the nationwide level. Based on the results of the Southern model, a single threshold F 1 was statistically significant at the 1% level and a double threshold F 2 was also statistically significant at the 1% level, while the test result of triple thresholds F 3 was not significant. We concluded that there are two temperature thresholds in the southern region of Taiwan. The estimates of the temperature thresholds are reported in Table 3.
